item.title: The Trial of Your Faith
item.description: Elder Neil L. Andersen teaches us to surround ourselves in spiritual things to help us overcome a trial of faith.

item.title: No Cussing Club
item.description: One boy’s crusade to encourage clean language has far-reaching effects.

item.title: "If They Harden Not Their Hearts"
item.description: This video depicts how pride led to the apostasy of Lyman Johnson and Thomas B. Marsh (D&C 112:1-16).

item.title: "Required to Forgive"
item.description: W. W. Phelps tells how he was forgiven by Joseph Smith (D&C 64:9-11).

item.title: Courage
item.description: Learn from the life of Esther and other inspiring women the importance of trusting in God and courageously standing up for what you believe.

item.title: Introduction to the Theme
item.description: Young women from around the world share how they can “Arise and shine forth” in 2012.

item.title: Light in Their Eyes
item.description: Because of a young woman’s goodness, an older woman’s life was changed.

item.title: Gather in Stakes
item.description: The Lord has commanded us to gather in stakes (D&C 101:20-22,63-75).

item.title: 195 Dresses
item.description: Have you ever noticed how hard it is to find a modest prom dress? One young woman in Arizona came up with a solution for her community.

item.title: Moments That Matter Most
item.description: We would do well to slow down a little, focus on the significant, lift up our eyes, and truly see the things that matter most.

item.title: Let Us Be Men
item.description: A true man makes sacrifices in order to honor his commitments.

item.title: "When He Falls He Shall Rise Again"
item.description: President Packer teaches about the Lord's counsel to Oliver Granger (D&C 117:12-15).

item.title: A Standing Law unto the Church
item.description: (D&C 119:3-7) President Hinckley tells a story of a woman who sacrificed to pay tithing.

item.title: The Miracle of Tithing
item.description: (D&C 119:3-7) President Hinckley teaches about the miracle of tithing.

item.title: Tithing Funds the Lord's Work
item.description: (D&C 119:1-3) Elder Oaks teaches how tithing funds the Lord's work.

item.title: Trial of Adversity
item.description: A woman paralyzed from the waist down didn’t let adversity stop her. With the Lord's help she thrived and is still excelling in spite of her injury.

item.title: None Were with Him
item.description: One of the great consolations of this Easter season is that because Jesus walked such a long, lonely path utterly alone, we do not have to do so.

item.title: Haun's Mill
item.description: President Eyring narrates a video portraying the events at Haun's Mill (D&C 121).

item.title: Move This Work Forward
item.description: (Daniel 2:31-45) President Hinckley encourages church members to lead by example and move the work of the Lord forward.

item.title: "The Powers of Heaven"
item.description: (D&C 121:34-46) The components and processes involved in providing electricity to a home are compared to the principles the Lord outlined in section 121 for those who would exercise His priesthood in power.

item.title: The Power of the Priesthood in the Family: Priesthood Power and Priesthood Authority
item.description: (5 of 6) Elder Oaks and Elder Golden explain the fundamental differences between priesthood power and authority. They teach how to have real power in the priesthood.

item.title: Our Constant Companion
item.description: Elder Bednar teaches about our constant companion, the Holy Ghost (D&C 121: 45-46).

item.title: Many Called; Few Chosen
item.description: Elder Bednar teaches how many are called, but few are chosen (D&C 121:34-36).

item.title: Flecks of Gold
item.description: This compelling story of an 1850s gold prospector illustrates how giving service to others blesses our lives.

item.title: Many Seek the Truth
item.description: Elder Oaks teaches about how many seek the truth (D&C 123:12-14).

item.title: Charity: An Example of the Believers
item.description: A group of young women reach out in kindness and charity to a student with a disability, fulfilling her dream and giving everyone something to cheer about. To read more about this inspiring example, visit: http://bit.ly/a5AjWz

item.title: Relief Society: An Enduring Legacy
item.description: Relief Society sisters share a glorious heritage of service and personal righteousness.

item.title: Sharing Your Beliefs
item.description: Use blogging, texting, and other forms of communication to share your testimony of the gospel to all the world.

item.title: Helping Others Understand the Truth
item.description: Elder Robert D. Hales testifies that questions and criticisms give us an opportunity to reach out to others and demonstrate that they matter to our Heavenly Father and to us.

item.title: Conversion Story—Simon
item.description: Simon shares how he gradually came to know that the Church was true.

item.title: Stand Up Boldly
item.description: Statement by Adrián Ochoa in the priesthood session on March 31, 2012.

item.title: Temple Blessings—Worth Every Sacrifice
item.description: Quote given by President Thomas S. Monson in the Sunday morning session of general conference on April 3, 2011.

item.title: Special Witness - President Eyring
item.description: President Henry B. Eyring bears his testimony of temples and the love of our Savior.

item.title: Temples are a Beacon
item.description: No sacrifice is too great to obtain the blessings available in Holy Temples.

item.title: The Time is Now
item.description: Elder Bednar and youth talk about doing family history research and the importance of engaging in the work of the temple.

item.title: A Steady, Reassuring Voice
item.description: (Ether 7:23–27) Elder Robert D. Hales teaches us to listen to the living prophets.

item.title: Priesthood and Priesthood Keys - We Are Brothers
item.description: A quorum comes to understand what it means to hold priesthood keys as they reach out to fellow quorum members.

item.title: "Take Especial Care of Your Family"
item.description: Elder Maxwell counsels us to take especial care of your family (D&C 126).

item.title: The Heart and a Willing Mind
item.description: (D&C 64:34) Elder Heber C. Kimball and his family willingly serve the Lord as Elder Kimball leaves first from Kirtland and then from Nauvoo to preach the gospel in England.

item.title: I’m a Mormon, a Barrister, and I’m Grateful for Trials
item.description: After scoliosis altered Mormon Lola Ogunbote’s dreams, she had to learn how to focus on the positive in her life. Now she can say that adversity is the backbone of her success. www.mormon.org/lola

item.title: The Sealing Power Binds and Looses on Earth and in Heaven
item.description: (Helaman 10:4–10) Elder Russell M. Nelson teaches what we must understand in preparing to receive temple ordinances.

item.title: Now We're Sealed—Now It's Forever
item.description: This video illustrates how family history work can create a desire to help a new member receive the blessings of the temple.

item.title: Time Well Spent
item.description: A couple in England shares how doing family history work has enhanced their experiences in the temple. They show the application of a principle outlined by Elder Richard G. Scott that "any work you do in the temple is time well spent, but receiving ordinances vicariously for one of your own ancestors will make the time in the temple more sacred." To get started finding your family members needing temple saving ordinances, visit FamilySearch.org.

item.title: Your Fingers Have Been Trained
item.description: The youth have been prepared to participate in temple and family history work.

item.title: Angels Are God’s Emissaries
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland describes the purpose and the ministry of angels.

item.title: Godhead
item.description: (Acts 7:55-56) Elder Dallin H. Oaks testifies of the three separate beings of the Godhead.

item.title: Joy in Families
item.description: The greatest joys in this life center in families, as they will in the worlds to come.

item.title: How Do I Love Thee?
item.description: Elder Holland gives a powerful talk about how you can better show love for your friends, family, dates or spouse by following the example of Jesus Christ.

item.title: The Second Coming Segment 1
item.description: Three general conference excerpts address modern-day issues concerning the Second Coming of the Savior. Segment 1 - Elder Boyd K. Packer. 2 Thessalonians 1:1-2:3

item.title: Standards: Education - The Glory of God Is Intelligence
item.description: Seeking learning is a lifelong pursuit and one that increases our ability to serve the Lord.

item.title: Focus on Education
item.description: The Church operates religious study programs for university and high-school age students throughout the world.

item.title: Enduring Love
item.description: Watch how this couple demonstrates pure love and service in their marriage—even though they have to endure debilitating physical adversity.

item.title: Knowledge of God and Jesus Christ
item.description: We need to know about Heavenly Father and Jesus Christ to be saved.

item.title: Holy Spirit of Promise
item.description: Elder Bednar teaches about the Holy Spirit of Promise (D&C 132:19,26).

item.title: For All Eternity
item.description: Elder Enrique Falabella describes the sacrifices he and his wife made to be married for eternity.

item.title: Israel, Israel, God Is Calling - Highlight 1
item.description: Elder Holland speaks of our need to be "caught" doing all we can to live the gospel.

item.title: Do Not Practice Polygamy
item.description: (Jacob 2:27–30) President Gordon B. Hinckley renounces the practice of polygamy.
